snippet: Personal website I created for my resume and to practice coding
description: This project actually has 2 different versions, one in Angular 2 and one in ReactJS. I originally wrote it in Angular 2, but I wanted to learn ReactJS and Webpack. The Angular 2 side is built using Angular CLI with Typescript, and employs the coding standards of a data api and service for each page as well as routing. The ReactJS version has a homemade Webpack & Babel configuration, and uses React Router. The website is also hosted on Google Cloud's app engine.
lookPoints: React and Angular componentization based on route

snippet: Web app for players to converge and compete against each other in a group
description: This project was born from my friend group's love of League of Legends and professional esports. We watch every week, and last year we decided to make a prediction game to predict the winner of each match. We kept track of each player's predictions on a google spreadsheet but quickly realized that that was not sustainable. So I decided to build a website for us to be able to track our predictions and see each other's. I chose ReactJS because I wanted to learn it, but also because there are lots of moving parts and I needed a robust componentization library. I also used Redux to keep track of all the data pulled and updated throughout the app. In the future, I plan on making this more robust, like seeing other player's rankings and winrates, as well as prizes for competing.
lookPoints: Minimal backend calls to keep Google Cloud prices low
NodeJS server connected to Google AppEngine and Google Flex
